intro: Wahlbergella albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered Wahlbergella, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves, and it produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Wahlbergella albiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
